1. REF: UN Chief Says There Is No Military Solution in Syria

    HYP: UN chief says there are no military solutions in Syria


  2. REF: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon says his response to Russia 's stepped up military support for Syria is that `` there is no military solution '' to the nearly five-year conflict and more weapons will only worsen the violence and misery for millions of people .

    HYP: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon says his response to Russia 's military support for Syria is that `` there is no military solution '' to the conflict that has lasted for nearly five years , and more weapons would only aggravate the violence and suffering of millions of people .


  3. REF: the U.N. chief again urged all parties , including the divided U.N. Security Council , to unite and support inclusive negotiations to find a political solution .

    HYP: the UN chief has again called on all sides , including the divided UN Security Council to unify and support negotiations to find a political solution .


  4. REF: ban told a news conference Wednesday that he plans to meet with foreign ministers of the five permanent council nations - the U.S. , Russia , China , Britain and France - on the sidelines of the General Assembly 's ministerial session later this month to discuss Syria .

    HYP: ban said on Wednesday at a conference that he plans to meet with foreign ministers from five permanent countries present in the council - the US , Russia , China , England and France - on the sidelines of the General Assembly 's ministerial session to discuss Syria .


  5. REF: he expressed regret that divisions in the council and among the Syrian people and regional powers `` made this situation unsolvable . ''

    HYP: ban expressed regret that divisions in the council and between the Syrian people and regional powers `` have made this difficult situation . ''


  6. REF: ban urged the five permanent members to show the solidarity and unity they did in achieving an Iran nuclear deal in addressing the Syria crisis .

    HYP: ban urged the five permanent members to show solidarity and unity shown when they managed to reach an agreement on Iran 's nuclear weapons , thus addressing the crisis in Syria .


  7. REF: 8 Poll Numbers That Show Donald Trump Is For Real

    HYP: 8 figures in polls showing Donald Trump has real chances


  8. REF: some have tried to label him a flip-flopper .

    HYP: some have tried to label him as a `` fridge-flop '' politician .


  9. REF: others have dismissed him as a joke .

    HYP: others called him a joke .


  10. REF: and some are holding out for an implosion .

    HYP: and others await the implosion .


  11. REF: but no matter how some Republicans are trying to drag Donald Trump down from atop the polls , it has n't worked ( yet ) .

    HYP: but no matter how some Republicans are trying to remove Donald Trump from the top of the polls , it has n't worked ( yet ) .


  12. REF: ten of the last 11 national polls have shown Donald Trump 's lead at double digits , and some are starting to ask seriously what it means for the real estate mogul 's nomination chances .

    HYP: ten of the last 11 national polls have shown Donald Trump leads with a percentage of two figures and some are starting to question seriously what this means for the chances of the real estate mogul 's appointment .


  13. REF: of course , it 's still early in the election cycle .

    HYP: of course , it is still premature .


  14. REF: none of this is to say that Trump is likely to win the Republican nomination .

    HYP: none of this says Trump will win the race for the Republicans ' nomination .


  15. REF: pundits point out that at this time in 2011 , Rick Perry 's lead was giving way to a rising Herman Cain , neither of whom won even one state in the nomination process .

    HYP: pundits shows that in the same period of 2011 , Rick Perry 's lead was taking place to Herman Cain in the polls , but none of them won in any state in the nomination race .


  16. REF: and there are many reasons he would struggle in a general election .

    HYP: and the reasons why it would struggle hard at the general election are numerous .


  17. REF: but outside groups like Jeb Bush 's Super PAC and the economic conservative group Club for Growth are recognizing Trump 's staying power and beginning to unload their dollars to topple him .

    HYP: but outside groups like Jeb Bush 's Super PAC and the conservative economic group Club for Growth acknowledge Trump 's power and are starting to support him with money .


  18. REF: here are some recent poll numbers that suggest that the real estate mogul is n't just a passing phase :

    HYP: we continue to present some figures from recent polls suggesting that the real estate mogul is not just something passing :

    HYP: figures indicating support for Trump have returned to 180 degrees .


  20. REF: right before Donald Trump announced his candidacy in mid-June , a Monmouth University poll showed only two in 10 Republicans had a positive view of the real estate mogul .

    HYP: just before Donald Trump announced his candidacy , in mid-June , a poll by the University of Monmouth shows that only two out of 10 Republicans had a positive view of the real estate mogul .


  21. REF: by mid-July , it was 40 percent .

    HYP: by mid-July , the percentage climbed to 40 per cent .


  22. REF: in early August , it was 52 percent .

    HYP: in early August , it was 52 per cent .


  23. REF: now , six in 10 Republicans have a favorable view of Donald Trump .

    HYP: currently , six out of 10 Republicans have a favorable view of Donald Trump .


  24. REF: roughly three in 10 say they have a negative view .

    HYP: about three out of 10 say they have a negative opinion .


  25. REF: and these numbers hold up in early states .

    HYP: those numbers remain .


  26. REF: a Quinnipiac poll in Iowa last week found that 60 percent of Republicans there had a favorable view of Trump .

    HYP: a poll conducted last week by Quinnipiac in Iowa concluded that 60 percent of Republicans in the region have a favorable view of Trump .


  27. REF: two-thirds of GOP voters would be happy with Trump as the nominee .

    HYP: two-thirds of GOP voters would be happy if Trump won the nomination race .


  28. REF: in a CNN/ORC poll last week , 67 percent of Republicans said they would be either `` enthusiastic '' or `` satisfied '' if Trump were the nominee .

    HYP: in a poll conducted by CNN / ORC last week , 67 percent of Republicans said they would be `` excited '' or `` satisfied '' if Trump would win the nomination race .


  29. REF: only two in 10 say they would be `` upset '' if he were the nominee .

    HYP: only two out of 10 say they would be `` upset '' if Trump won the nomination race .


  30. REF: only Ben Carson generates roughly the same level of enthusiasm as Trump ( 43 percent say they would be `` enthusiastic '' vs. 40 percent who say the same of Trump ) .

    HYP: only Ben Carson generates about the same level of enthusiasm as Trump ( 43 per cent say they would be `` excited '' about 40 per cent who say the same about Trump ) .


  31. REF: the next closest in enthusiasm ?

    HYP: closest to the excitement ?


  32. REF: Marco Rubio with only 21 percent .

    HYP: Marco Rubio , with just 21 per cent .


  33. REF: on the flip side , 47 percent of Republican voters say they would be `` dissatisfied '' or `` upset '' if establishment favorite Jeb Bush becomes the nominee .

    HYP: on the other side , 47 percent of Republican voters say they would be `` unhappy '' or `` upset '' if Jeb Bush 's favorite wins the nomination race .


  34. REF: a majority of Republicans do n't see Trump 's temperament as a problem .

    HYP: most Republicans do n't see Trump 's temperament a problem .


  35. REF: while Donald Trump has been widely criticized for his bombast and insults , 52 percent of leaned Republican voters nationwide think that the real estate mogul has the right temperament to be president , according to Monday 's ABC News/Washington Post poll .

    HYP: while Donald Trump has been strongly criticised for his insults and his bombastic style , 52 percent of Republican voters nationwide believe the real estate mogul has the right temperament to be president , according to ABC News / Washington Post 's poll on Monday .


  36. REF: the same number holds in the first-in-the-nation caucus state of Iowa , where the same 52 percent of Republicans think he has the personality to be commander in chief , according to Quinnipiac last week .

    HYP: the Kings are the same figures in the state of Iowa , where all 52 percent of Republicans believe Trump has the right personality to be ruler , according to the poll conducted last week by Quinnipiac .


  37. REF: still , 44 percent think he does n't have the personality to serve effectively , and almost six in 10 independents say his temperament does not belong in the White House , according to ABC/Post .

    HYP: however , 44 per cent say he does n't have the personality needed to act effectively , and nearly six out of 10 independents say his temperament does not have what he is looking for at the White House , according to ABC / Post .


  38. REF: Republican voters are getting used to the idea .

    HYP: Republican voters are enjoying the idea .


  39. REF: when they put on their pundit hats , Republican voters think Trump is for real .

    HYP: when they take the attitude of intellectuals , Republican voters believe Trump is authentic .


  40. REF: when asked who is most likely to win the GOP nomination , four in 10 said Trump was the best bet , according to a CNN/ORC poll out last week .

    HYP: according to a CNN / ORC poll last week , at the question of who has the most chance to win the GOP nomination race , four out of 10 said Trump .


  41. REF: that 's a change from when four in 10 placed their money on Jeb Bush in late July .

    HYP: the situation changed to the end of July when four out of 10 would have gambled on Jeb Bush .


  42. REF: full disclosure : GOP voters have n't had the clearest crystal ball in the past .

    HYP: full information : in the past , GOP voters did n't read the future very well .

    HYP: in the same period of the last election , four out of 10 Republicans elected Rick Perry in the nomination race , versus only 28 percent for Mitt Romney .


  44. REF: still , it shows that a plurality of GOP voters see Trump 's campaign as plausible .

    HYP: but these figures show that most GOP voters consider Trump 's campaign plausible .


  45. REF: even if Republicans rallied around another candidate , Trump still beats almost everyone .

    HYP: even if Republicans or replay for another candidate , Trump is still at the top of all .


  46. REF: some pundits point out that the splintered field is likely contributing to Trump 's lead , while anti-Trump support is be spread diffusely among more than a dozen other candidates .

    HYP: some say the divided situation is likely to contribute to Trump 's victory , while prop Donald Trump will split up to more than a dozen candidates .


  47. REF: but a Monmouth University poll in early September shows that , in a hypothetical head-to-head matchup between Trump and most other Republican candidates , Trump almost always garners majority support .

    HYP: but a poll conducted in early September by the University of Monmouth shows that in the hypothetical situation of a collaboration between Trump and most other Republican candidates , almost always Trump will benefit from majority support .


  48. REF: he leads Carly Fiorina by 13 points , Marco Rubio by 14 points , Walker by 15 points , Jeb Bush by 19 points , and , finally , Rand Paul , John Kasich and Chris Christie by 33 points each .

    HYP: Trump is at the distance of 13 points by Carly Fiorina , 14 points from Marco Rubio , at 15 points of Walker , at 19 points at Jeb Bush and finally , at 33 points from Rand Paul , John Kasich and Chris Christie .


  49. REF: he 's in a dead heat with Ted Cruz .

    HYP: he 's almost on par with Ted Cruz .


  50. REF: the only candidate who beats him ?

    HYP: the only candidate who beats him ?


  51. REF: Ben Carson would lead the businessman by a wide 19 points in a hypothetical head-to-head .

    HYP: Ben Carson would beat the businessman with 19 points in a hypothetical one-to-one showdown .


  52. REF: a bare majority of Donald Trump 's supporters say they 've made up their minds .

    HYP: most of Donald Trump 's supporters say they have decided .

    HYP: a new poll by CBS / NYT on Tuesday shows that more than half of voters who support Trump say they do n't change their voting option .


  54. REF: obviously , a lot can happen to change that , and no one can really say they would never change their mind .

    HYP: obviously , much can happen in this regard , and no one can say that they will never change .


  55. REF: 46 percent said they are leaving the door open to switching candidates .

    HYP: 46 per cent say it leaves the window open to the possibility of changing their choice .

    HYP: six out of 10 Republicans say they agree with Trump on immigration .

    HYP: since Donald Trump called immigrants from Mexico `` rapists '' in his campaign 's opening speech two months ago , immigration was the focus of the 2016 campaign .

    HYP: but according to the ABC / Post poll Monday , six out of 10 Republicans say they agree with Trump on immigration .

    HYP: the ASA , however , seems as long as the issue of immigration remains in the spotlight , so will Doland Trump .

    HYP: frustration with the authorities is reaching new cull .


  63. REF: Donald Trump and Ben Carson now account for roughly half of the support from Republican voters , largely due to their outsider status .

    HYP: Donald Trump and Ben Carson are now backed by nearly half of Republican voters , largely thanks to their status of outfits .

    HYP: according to the ABC / Post poll Monday , six out of 10 Republicans say they prefer a political outsider at the expense of someone with experience in government .

    HYP: people are also upset by Washington .

    HYP: Jeremy Corbyn makes his debut at Prime Minister 's

    HYP: Mr Corbyn will address the first of six questions he is entitled shortly after lunch ; his performance will likely be closely scrutinised by the media and Labour MPs .

    HYP: in the weekly appearances , he called for `` less theatre and more facts . ''


  72. REF: he has also said he could skip some sessions , leaving them to colleagues .

    HYP: he also said he can drop a few extras and give them to his colleagues .

    HYP: the confrontation will be Mr Corbyn 's first parliamentary test in a leadership position , coming after he called a `` ghost cabinet '' and after his speech Tuesday at the annual TUC congress .


  74. REF: meanwhile , the Labour leader 's decision to stand in silence during the singing of the national anthem at a service on Tuesday to mark the 75th anniversary of the Battle of Britain has attracted criticism from a number of Tory MPs and is the focus of several front page stories in the newspapers .

    HYP: meanwhile , the Labour Party leader 's decision to keep quiet at the rosse of the national anthem at a service held on Tuesday on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the England battle drew criticism from conservative MPs and held the front page of the headlines .


  75. REF: Mr Corbyn 's decision not to sing the national anthem has attracted attention

    HYP: Mr Corbyn 's decision not to sing national anthem drew attention


  76. REF: a spokesman for Mr Corbyn said he had `` stood in respectful silence '' and did recognise the `` heroism of the Royal Air Force in the Battle of Britain . ''

    HYP: a spokesman for Mr Corbyn said he `` kept quiet respectfully '' and acknowledged `` the heroism of British air forces in the Battle of England . ''


  77. REF: but a member of Mr Corbyn 's shadow cabinet , Owen Smith , told BBC Two 's Newsnight programme he would have advised the Labour leader to sing the national anthem `` irrespective '' of his belief that the monarchy should be abolished .

    HYP: but a member of Corbyn 's ghost cabinet , Owen Smith , told the BBC 's Chapo 's Newsnight that it would have recommended the Labour leader sing the national anthem `` no matter '' of his faith that the monarchy should be abolished .


  78. REF: nearly a dozen shadow ministers have refused to serve in Mr Corbyn 's top team , citing differences over the economy , defence and foreign affairs , while less than a sixth of the parliamentary party originally backed him as leader .

  79. REF: BBC political correspondent Robin Brant says policy differences are also `` stacking up '' within Labour following Mr Corbyn 's appointment over its position on the European Union and the government 's cap on benefits .

    HYP: BBC political correspondent Robin Brant says the political differences `` get stuck '' in the Labour Party after Mr Corbyn 's appointment on his position towards the European Union and the benefits limit .


  80. REF: Mr Corbyn told the TUC conference Labour was putting forward amendments to remove the whole idea of a cap altogether .

    HYP: Mr Corbyn told the TUC conference that the Labour Party would bring changes to which it would completely eliminate the idea of limitation .


  81. REF: hours later Mr Smith , the shadow work and pensions secretary , said the party was `` very clear '' that it was only opposing government plans to reduce the level of cap from 26,000 to 23,000 .

    HYP: hours later , Mr Smith , Labour and Pennings Minister , said the party `` is very clear '' in exclusive opposition to government plans to cut the `` head '' level from 26,000 to 23,000 .


  82. REF: Mr Corbyn will be the fifth Labour leader that David Cameron has faced across the despatch box over the past decade since he became Tory leader .

    HYP: Mr Corbyn will be the fifth Labour leader facing David Cameron on the floor in the last decade since he took the helm of the Conservative Party .

    HYP: the Labour leader , who has promised a different approach to politics , says he has ideas `` from foreign sources '' for questions to ask Mr Cameron and that he has received more than 30,000 suggestions .

    HYP: MP Islington North said PMQs involve a level of confrontation too high and that it would refrain from aftershocks and attacks , pledging to focus instead on serious issues such as poverty , inequality and challenges facing young people .

    HYP: Mr Corbyn said Angela Eagle , the finance minister , would hold her seat at PMQs when he ca n't attend - for example when Mr Cameron moves abroad .

    HYP: he also expressed the idea that he would allow other colleagues to speak occasionally , saying he approached House of Deputies Speaker John Berkeley to discuss the issue .

    HYP: in 2005 , when he took the lead , Mr Cameron said he wanted to give up the political style `` Punch and Judy '' often associated with PMQs but admitted several years later that he had failed in his work .


  88. REF: since it was first televised in 1990 , PMQs has been seen as a key barometer of a leader 's judgement , their command of the Commons and their standing among their fellow MPs although critics have argued it has become a caricature and is in need of far-reaching reforms .

    HYP: since the first broadcast in 1990 , PMQs has been considered a key barometer of a leader 's reasoning , of how he heads the Chamber of Deputies and his position among fellow MPs , although critics say he has become a caricature and that he needs deep reform .

    HYP: the teenager is currently in Glasgow where he is battling Sam Groth for second spot after Bernard Tomic in the Davis Cup semi-final against England .

  107. REF: but , really , he 's handled himself extremely well , in pretty provocative circumstances in the US with Harrison and so on , and I think he deserves a lot of credit .

    HYP: but let 's be serious , he has mastered extremely well in pretty challenging situations in the U.S. with Harrison and so on and I think he deserves a lot of confidence .


  108. REF: he 's a great team around him , he 's got a great family around him and I just think he 's been a little hard done by .

    HYP: he has an extraordinary team , he has a great family alongside and I think he was treated unfairly .


  109. REF: he 's a very mature 19-year-old , he works very hard , and he fits in with the team and so on , he has n't ever had an issue with the other players , he 's well respected in the locker room , he trains hard , he 's in great shape , he 's a very stable and mature young guy and I just think he deserves to be judged on his own merits .

    HYP: he 's a very mature 19-year-old , working hard and integrated into the team , he has n't had any clash with the other players , he 's very respected at the Broncos , he trains hard , he 's in excellent form , he 's a very balanced and mature young man and I think he deserves to be judged solely on the basis of his qualities and faults .


  110. REF: Healy also backed the decision to overlook Kyrgios for the important tie , starting on Friday , describing the `` mutual decision '' as the right thing for all , but backing the Canberran to return as a long-term fixture in the team .

    HYP: Healy also backed the decision not to consider Kyrgios for the key replay game , which starts on Friday , and described the `` joint decision '' as the most suited to all , but he supported the return of the player originally from Canberra in the long run in the team .


  111. REF: `` First of all we want the team to be completely focused on the tie and not all the controversy around [ Kyrgios ] , '' Healy said .

    HYP: `` First of all , we want the team to focus entirely on the replay game and not think at all about the controversy around [ Kyrgios ] , '' Healy said .


  112. REF: and I think Nick , he 's risen very quickly , as people like Federer and Murray have pointed out , he 's growing up in the public eye and he 's made some terrible errors and deserves all the criticism he gets , but we 're trying to support him , we 're trying to help him understand the consequences of his actions , and some time out of the limelight where he can just reflect on that I think is appropriate and it 's best for the team and it 's best for him .

    HYP: and I think Nick has climbed very quickly , as people like Federer and Murray have said , he 's matured under the eyes of the public and made some terrible mistakes and deserves to be criticised , but we 're trying to support him , we try to help him understand the consequences of his deeds and I think he needs a while not in the spotlight to be able to reflect , good thing for both the team and him .

    HYP: election 2016 : Hillary Clinton 's advantage over Bernie Sanders has shrunk to half in national polls

    HYP: former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton still has a two-figure advantage in the Democratic race for national candidacy , but Sen. Bernie Sanders is gaining ground .

    HYP: Clinton is now backed by 47 per cent of Democratic voters ( down from 58 per cent ) while Sanders is second with 27 per cent ( up from 17 per cent ) .


  116. REF: vice President Joe Biden , who has yet to announce whether he is running for president , receives support from 15 percent of Democratic primary voters .

    HYP: vice President Joe Biden , who has yet to announce whether he will run for president , is backed by 15 per cent of Democratic voters .


  117. REF: more than five months before the start of the primary contests , most Democratic voters say it is too early to say that their minds are made up about which candidate they will support .

    HYP: with at least five months before the start of the primary election , most Democratic voters say it is too early to say they have decided on the candidate they will support .

    HYP: but Clinton 's supporters are more decisive in their choice than supporters of other candidates .

    HYP: Clinton retains the advantage among women and moderates , but the advantage has dwindled .

    HYP: support among men has narrowed considerably and Sanders is at a distance of just 5 points .

    HYP: six percent would not support it .

    HYP: opinions are more mixed among those who do n't currently support Clinton - only about a quarter would support it enthusiastically .

    HYP: `` It seems that there is a tendency for capital profitability to falter for 12-24 months after the first increase , which reflects once again the defect in monetary policy , '' Deutsche Bank analysts said in a recent survey on what would happen after Fed increases .


  194. REF: more specifically , the market over the past 35 years or so is most often up sharply - about 14 percent - heading into the rate hike , fairly flat in the 250 days after ( average gain of 2.6 percent ) then back to normal once 500 days have passed , with average return in the past six cycles of 14.4 percent , according to a recent analysis Bob Doll , chief equity strategist at Nuveen Asset Management , posted on Barron 's .

    HYP: more specifically , over the past 35 years , the market has risen sharply - by about 14 percent - heading towards an interest rate rise , rather flammable in the 250-day period after ( an average of 2.6 per cent ) after returning to normal after 500 days , with an average return in the past six cycles of 14.4 per cent , according to a recent analysis published on Barron by chief strategist of Nuveen Asset Management .

    HYP: Deutsche said the impact on shares tend to become more pronounced later in the rate hike cycle and benefits start to fall .

REF: on the other hand , the conversion offer of Banca Transilvania was accepted by 83 % of clients with loans in francs due to two successive reductions : the balance with the amount of risk and management fees paid by the client was reduced , and then a further reduction of 22.5 % was applied to the balance in lei .

  300. REF: benefits

    HYP: benefits

    HYP: the main advantage of the redemption of credit in CHF is that the currency risk is being removed , with the consumer being protected by the future increases in the franchise , and repayment will be made in the currency in which it collects its salary .


  302. REF: another majour advantage of both offers of conversion is that a revaluation of property is not performed and additional guarantees and another proof of income are not required .

    HYP: another major advantage of both conversion offers is that no reassessment of the property is made , no additional guarantees and other income proof are required .


  303. REF: basically , a new financial and legal analysis of the loan is not performed and additional costs in case of a refinancing will not be charged .

    HYP: in practical terms , there will be no new financial and legal analysis of credit , nor will it be additional costs as in the case of a refunding .

  578.     HYP: on this occasion , border police discovered , hidden in semi-trailers as automakers , including plastic bags , two male people .

  1298.     HYP: the government approved , on Wednesday , the `` national immigration strategy for the period 2015-2018 '' and the `` Action Plan on the Year , '' documents deemed to be `` still a stage Romania is going through as part of efforts to modernise the immigration management process on national territory , '' according to a press release .


  1299. REF: the source shows that the strategy aims at the efficient management of the immigration phenomenon , including strategic goals , specific objectives and courses of action which reflect the policies established at European level , adapted to national realities .

    HYP: the source quoted as saying that the strategy aims to effectively manage the phenomenon of immigration , including general strategic objectives , specific objectives and action directions that reflect the policies set at European level , adapted to national realities .


  1300. REF: given the problems faced by Romania 's neighbouring countries , measures for the unified and coherent management of the situation are taken into consideration due to the possible influx of illegal immigrants in Romania , generated by the crisis situations of political , social , economic or military nature .

    HYP: in view of the problems faced by the countries of the immediate neighbourhood of Romania , measures are being considered for the uniform and coherent management of situations stemming from the possible appearance of an influx of illegal immigrants into Romania 's territory , resulting from crises of political , social , economic or military nature .


  1301. REF: `` Romanian authorities will contribute to the establishment of a flexible admission system , but at the same time , they will pay special attention to citizens from countries with migration potential or who may affect national security , '' adds the mentioned source .

    HYP: `` The Romanian authorities will contribute to the creation of a flexible admission system , but at the same time , they will pay particular attention to citizens coming from countries with potential migration or which can achieve national safety , '' the source added .


  1302. REF: the strategy identifies a number of factors that can influence immigration and asylum , including the continuation of the conflict situation in Syria , the reactivation of the Iraq conflict , maintaining an unstable situation in Romania 's bordering areas ( Ukraine , Transnistria ) , continuation and intensification of the Israeli - Palestinian armed conflict .

    HYP: the strategy identifies a number of factors that can influence immigration and asylum , including maintaining the conflict situation in Syria , the reactivation of the conflict in Iraq , maintaining an unstable situation in the outlying areas of Romania ( Ukraine , Transnistria ) , perpetuating and increasing the intensity of the Israeli-Palestinian armed conflict .


  1303. REF: on the other hand , the document sets some general strategic objectives regarding immigration , such as : promotion of legal migration , tighter controls of legal residence of third-country citizens in Romania and the appropriate application of removal and restrictive measures , improvement of the national asylum system .

    HYP: on the other hand , the document also sets several general strategic objectives relating to immigration , such as : promoting legal migration , more rigorous controls on the legality of the residence of third-country nationals on Romania 's territory and the proper application of measures to move away and restrictive measures , the improvement of the national asylum system .


  1304. REF: the National Strategy includes specific objectives relevant for transposing and implementing overall strategic objectives .

    HYP: the national strategy also includes relevant specific objectives for the transposition and implementation of the general strategic objectives .


  1305. REF: these include : facilitating access in Romania of third party citizens that meet the employment needs , favouring access of third countries citizens for higher education institutions in Romania for fields and professions identified as deficient .

    HYP: these include : facilitating access to Romanian territory of third-party nationals who respond to employment needs , favouring the access of third-country nationals to higher education institutions in Romania for the areas and professions identified as flawed .

    HYP: with regard to the 2015 Action Plan , the Government appreciates that it is ' a means by which concrete activities are set to lead to the creation of a flexible system for halting the growing migrant phenomenon ' .

    HYP: the courses address all those who are passionate about art , regardless of age or experience .
